summary: The Seized Iranian Arms Transfer Authorization Act of 2025 (SEIZE Act) authorizes the President to treat weapons and materiel seized by the U.S. while en route from Iran to the Houthis in Yemen as U.S. stocks. The President can then provide these to foreign partners. The bill mandates reports to Congress on the use of this authority, including inventories of seized and distributed materiel. The term "appropriate committees of Congress" is defined for reporting purposes.
